svg.text: AI Impact on Technical Careers: Data-Driven Analysis 2024-2030
Based on research from Gartner, McKinsey, WEF Future of Jobs 2025, MIT CSAIL, Stanford SALT Lab

g.text: Focus on system architecture, AI integration
Multi-cloud strategy, edge computing, AI workloads
AI product strategy, ethics, user experience
NEW AI-CREATED JOBS (170M new roles by 2030 - WEF Future of Jobs 2025¹¹)
• 80% of engineering workforce needs upskilling by 2027 (Gartner)
• 75% of enterprise software engineers will use AI code assistants by 2028 (Gartner)
• Only 23% of vision-based tasks economically viable for AI automation currently (MIT CSAIL)
• 46% of workers positive about AI automation of their tasks (Stanford SALT Lab)
• 40% of employers expect workforce reduction where AI applicable (WEF 2025)
• AI Impact %: Predicted change in demand/nature of role (-100% to +100%). Negative = automation/reduction, Positive = growth
• Uncertainty %: Confidence interval (0-50%). Low (0-15%) = clear trends, High (30-50%) = many unknowns
• Mitigation/Strategy: Key actions to remain valuable in the evolving job market
QA Engineer (-55% impact, 25% uncertainty): High automation risk, actual impact could range -30% to -80%
AI/ML Engineer (+56% impact, 20% uncertainty): Growing demand with moderate confidence, likely range +36% to +76%
Technical Lead (-10% impact, 15% uncertainty): Slight reduction but stable, human leadership remains essential
¹ Microsoft layoffs May 2025: 6,000 positions, 40% software engineers citing AI automation
² Big Tech companies reduced new graduate hiring by 25% in 2024 (accelerating in 2025)
³ McKinsey State of AI 2024: 78% of organizations using AI in at least one business function
⁴ GitHub Copilot research: 55% faster task completion, 30% suggestion acceptance rate
⁵ Gartner 2024: 56% of software engineering leaders rate AI/ML engineer as most in-demand
⁶ McKinsey 2024: 71% of organizations regularly use gen AI in at least one function
⁷ Business automation statistics 2024: 60% of companies implemented automation
⁸ Tableau AI 2024: Reducing repetitive tasks for data analysts with smart suggestions
⁹ ISC2 AI in Cyber 2024: 88% of cybersecurity professionals seeing AI impact
¹⁰ ISC2 Survey: 82% report AI improving job efficiency in cybersecurity
¹¹ WEF Future of Jobs 2025: 170M new roles created, 92M displaced by 2030 (net +78M)
¹² McKinsey 2024: 13% of organizations hired AI compliance specialists
• MIT CSAIL: Economic viability is key limiting factor for AI automation, suggesting gradual integration
• Stanford SALT Lab: 36% of occupations already using AI for 25%+ of tasks (Anthropic usage data, 2025)
• Worker concerns: Lack of trust (45%), job replacement fear (23%), absence of human touch (16.3%)
• Accenture study: 84% increase in successful builds with GitHub Copilot, 96% adoption success rate
Data compiled from: Gartner (2024), McKinsey Global Survey on AI (2024), WEF Future of Jobs Report (2025),
MIT CSAIL automation study, Stanford SALT Lab, ISC2 Cybersecurity Survey, GitHub Copilot research
